title: Mathematical Inquiry Competency Strengthening Through Social Media Data Science

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: A process for pre-service teachers to explore data science practices and mathematical problem-solving using social media data in smartphone environments, featuring an open sandbox approach that allows learners to autonomously select topics and conduct projects.

learning_goals: Learners can perform mathematical analyses (hypothesis testing, trend analysis, etc.) based on data collected from social media platforms
Learners can design and execute all stages of data-driven problem definition → analysis → interpretation through open-ended inquiry processes
Learners can develop analysis protocols using data collection and visualization tools (e.g., Google Sheets, OpenRefine Mobile) even in limited technological environments (smartphone-centric)

resources: Free Data Analysis Tools (Google Sheets, OpenRefine Mobile)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
